Review workflows associated with your models, and initiate or abort workflows configured for your organization on your models.

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] The model is registered in the model inventory.[^1]
- [x] Workflows have already been set up for use with your models.[^2]
- [x] You are a assigned role with sufficient permissions to view and run workflows on models.[^3]

:::

## Initiate model workflows

::: {.callout}
By default, the [{{< fa hand >}} Customer Admin]{.bubble} role has sufficient permissions to manually start model workflows.
:::

To manually start a workflow[^4] for a specific model:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^5]

3. On the landing page of your model, locate the [active workflows]{.smallcaps} section.

4. Click **{{< fa arrow-right-arrow-left >}} See All Workflows**.

5. Select **{{< fa arrow-right >}} Run Workflow** for the workflow you'd like to initiate, then select your desired **[workflow start]{.smallcaps}** option:

    - **Run Now** — Workflow starts instantly.
    - **Scheduled Run** — Set a future date to run the workflow.

6. Click **{{< fa arrow-right >}} Run Workflow Now** to confirm.

### Resume workflows

To manually resume a workflow in a {{< fa clock >}} Wait state:[^6]

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^7]

3. On the landing page of your model, locate the [active workflows]{.smallcaps} section.

4. For the workflow you'd like to manually advance, click **{{< fa arrow-right-arrow-left >}} Resume Workflow** to open up the workflow's step overview.

5. On the **{{< fa clock >}} Wait** step, double-click on **{{< fa arrow-right-arrow-left >}}** to advance the workflow immediately.

## Abort workflows

::: {.callout}
By default, the [{{< fa hand >}} Customer Admin]{.bubble} role has sufficient permissions to abort workflows.
:::

To cancel a run of a workflow on a model:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^8]

3. On the landing page of your model, locate the [active workflows]{.smallcaps} section.

4. Click on the name of the workflow you'd like to abort to open that specific workflow's details.

5. On the workflow's detail modal, click on the **{{< fa ellipsis-vertical >}}** in the top-right hand corner and select **{{< fa ban >}} Abort Workflow**.

6. On the confirmation page, leave **[restart workflow after aborting]{.smallcaps}** untoggled, then click **{{< fa arrow-right >}} Yes, Abort Workflow** to abort your workflow.
